label: A rdfs:label
definition: AL definition@en SPLIT=|
example of usage: A example of usage SPLIT=|
parent class: CI

label: image data set
definition: A data set that is comprised of multidimensional structured measurements and metadata required for a morphological representation of an entity. An image data set can be the source from which an image (such as a 2D image using pixels or a 3D image using voxels) is produced.
example of usage: The output produced by a digital imaging technique, such as microscopy, MRI, or CT.
term editor: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9625-1899 ""William D. Duncan"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7245-3450 ""Lauren M. Wishnie"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9676-7377 ""Alexander D. Bartnik"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9990-8331 ""Alexander D. Diehl"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2104-0568 ""Lucas M. Serra"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9821-4132 ""Mackenzie T. Smith""
parent class: data set

label: magnetic resonance image data set
definition: An image data set whose information content originates from some MR imaging assay and is about some MRI participant.
example of usage: The DICOM file produced by an MRI machine when a multiple sclerosis patient undergoes a brain scan.
term editor: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9625-1899 ""William D. Duncan"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7245-3450 ""Lauren M. Wishnie"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9676-7377 ""Alexander D. Bartnik"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9990-8331 ""Alexander D. Diehl"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2104-0568 ""Lucas M. Serra"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9821-4132 ""Mackenzie T. Smith""
parent class: image data set

label: raw image data set
definition: An image data set that encodes measurement values produced by some instrument before undergoing a data transformation.
example of usage: The untransformed (""k-space"") data produced by an MRI machine, prior to mathematical transformation into a form that corresponds to the anatomical structure of the brain.
term editor: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9625-1899 ""William D. Duncan"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7245-3450 ""Lauren M. Wishnie"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9676-7377 ""Alexander D. Bartnik"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9990-8331 ""Alexander D. Diehl"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2104-0568 ""Lucas M. Serra"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9821-4132 ""Mackenzie T. Smith"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1604-3078 ""Alan Ruttenberg""
parent class: image data set

label: computed image data set
definition: An image data set that is the output of an image data set analysis.
example of usage: The production of JPEG file by a digital camera.
term editor: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9625-1899 ""William D. Duncan"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9676-7377 ""Alexander D. Bartnik"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9990-8331 ""Alexander D. Diehl"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1604-3078 ""Alan Ruttenberg"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7245-3450 ""Lauren M. Wishnie"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9821-4132 ""Mackenzie T. Smith""
parent class: image data set

label: reconstructed magnetic resonance image data set
definition: An image data set that is the direct output of a raw magnetic resonance image data set reconstruction or a transformation of another MR image data set.
example of usage: The product of a mathematical transformation of raw ""k-space"" data produced by an MRI machine into a form that represents the anatomical structure of the brain.
term editor: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9625-1899 ""William D. Duncan"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9676-7377 ""Alexander D. Bartnik"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9990-8331 ""Alexander D. Diehl"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2104-0568 ""Lucas M. Serra"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7245-3450 ""Lauren M. Wishnie"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9821-4132 ""Mackenzie T. Smith""
parent class: computed image data set

label: diffusion weighted magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A type of magnetic resonance image data set collected using at least three diffusion gradients of some factor ""b,"" which is a function of the amplitude, duration, and interval of the gradiants.
example of usage: MRI used for assessing structural integrity of brain axons and visualizing ischemia.
parent class: reconstructed magnetic resonance image data set

label: functional magnetic resonance image data set
definition: An magnetic resonance image data set collected as a 4D time series representing changes in brain metabolism (i.e. BOLD), typically used as a proxy for brain activity.
example of usage: MRI used for assessing brain activity via blood oxygen level dependent signal.
term editor: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9676-7377 ""Alexander D. Bartnik"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9990-8331 ""Alexander D. Diehl"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9625-1899 ""William D. Duncan"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2104-0568 ""Lucas M. Serra""
parent class: reconstructed magnetic resonance image data set

label: resting state functional magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A type of functional MRI in which the participant is not given a task, but just rests during acquisision
example of usage: An fMRI used for assessing functional connectivity of brain regions at rest.
parent class: functional magnetic resonance image data set

label: task-based functional magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A type of functional MRI in which the participant is given a task or tasks, which are timed with the acquisition
example of usage: fMRI type used for assessing brain activity while performing an action or in response to stimuli.
parent class: functional magnetic resonance image data set

label: perfusion weighted magnetic resonance image data set
definition: An magnetic resonance image data set that captures volume and flow of blood in the brain.
example of usage: MRI used for evaluating ischemia.
parent class: reconstructed magnetic resonance image data set

label: proton density magnetic resonance image data set
definition: An magnetic resonance image data set in which the contrast emphasizes density of protons, supressing T1 and T2 effects
example of usage: MRI used for visualizing structure of tissue.
parent class: reconstructed magnetic resonance image data set

label: T1 weighted magnetic resonance image data set
definition: An magnetic resonance image acquired using a T1 weighted magnetic resonance image acquisition sequence.
example of usage: MRI used for visualizing structure of tissue where fluid is hypointense.
parent class: reconstructed magnetic resonance image data set

label: post-Gd T1 weighted magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A T1 weighted image data set where gadolidium contrast agent has been administered to the participant before image acquistion.
example of usage: MRI used for assessing breakdown of blood brain barrier.
parent class: T1 weighted magnetic resonance image data set

label: T1 weighted GRE magnetic resonance image data set
definition: T1 weighted image data set collected using a gradient recall echo sequence.
example of usage: MRI used for computational research on the structure of tissue.
parent class: T1 weighted magnetic resonance image data set

label: high resolution T1 weighted magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A T1-weighted image data set acquired from an NMR/MRI machine with at least a 3 Tesla magnet and in which the voxel size is isotropic.
example of usage: MRI used for computational segmentation of tissue due to high quality.
parent class: T1 weighted GRE magnetic resonance image data set

label: baseline high resolution T1 weighted magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A T1w image data set collected at an evaluant's first visit in a study.
example of usage: First MRI acquired as part of longitudinal study.
parent class: T1 weighted GRE magnetic resonance image data set

label: follow-up high resolution T1 weighted magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A T1w image data set collected at a later time than the evaluant's first scan.
example of usage: MRI acquired after the first scan as part of longitudinal study.
parent class: T1 weighted GRE magnetic resonance image data set

label: T1 weighted SE magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A T1 weighted image data set acquired using a spin echo sequence.
example of usage: MRI used for visualizing structure of tissue, often of lower quality than a GRE sequence.
parent class: T1 weighted magnetic resonance image data set

label: T2 weighted magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A magnetic resonance image produced by a T2 weighted magnetic resonance image acquisition sequence.
example of usage: MRI used for visualizing structure of tissue where fluid is hyperintense.
parent class: reconstructed magnetic resonance image data set

label: T2 weighted FLAIR magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A T2 weighted image data set collected using a FLAIR sequence.
example of usage: MRI used for visualizing lesions in multiple sclerosis.
parent class: T2 weighted magnetic resonance image data set

label: T2 weighted FSE  magnetic resonance image data set
alternative label: T2 weighted TSE magnetic resonance image data set
definition: T2 weighted image collected using a fast/turbo spin echo sequence.
example of usage: MRI used for visualizing structure of tissue with fast acquisition times.
parent class: T2 weighted magnetic resonance image data set

label: T2 weighted SE magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A type of T2-weighted image in which the acquisition is performed using a 2D spin-echo technique
example of usage: MRI used for visualizing structure of tissue, often longer acquisition than FSE sequence.
parent class: T2 weighted magnetic resonance image data set

label: T2 weighted STIR magnetic resonance image data set
definition: A T2 weighted magnetic resonance image data set collected using a STIR sequence to suppress the signal coming from fat.
example of usage: MRI used for visualizing structure of tissue where signal from fat is suppressed.
parent class: T2 weighted magnetic resonance image data set

label: T2* weighted GRE magnetic resonance image data set
definition: T2* weighted image data set collected using a gradient echo sequence.
example of usage: MRI better suited for identifying focal pathology than T2w SE sequences.
parent class: T2 weighted magnetic resonance image data set

label: raw magnetic resonance image data set
definition: An image data set that is the direct output of an magnetic resonance imaging assay and whose values encode spatial frequencies produced by the NMR or MRI instrument.
example of usage: The untransformed (""k-space"") data produced by an MRI machine, prior to mathematical transformation into a form that corresponds to the anatomical structure of the brain.
parent class: raw image data set

label: brain region atlas image data set
definition: An image data set consisting of values computed from multiple image data sets encoded to represent the spatial location of individual functional or structural regions of a canonical brain.
example of usage: The Desikan-Killiany brain region atlas used by the FreeSurfer software suite.
term editor: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9625-1899 ""William D. Duncan"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9676-7377 ""Alexander D. Bartnik"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9990-8331 ""Alexander D. Diehl"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7245-3450 ""Lauren M. Wishnie"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9821-4132 ""Mackenzie T. Smith""
parent class: computed image data set

label: probabilistic brain region atlas image dataset
definition: A brain atlas consisting of weighted values that respresent the probability that a voxel X is part of some brain component Y, typically derived from multiple image data sets.
example of usage: A brain atlas of resting-state functional networks derived from the probability that disparate brains regions are active at the same time.
parent class: brain region atlas image data set

label: deterministic brain region atlas image data set
definition: A brain atlas consisting of discrete integer values where a value X denotes a voxel is part of some brain component Y.
example of usage: The JHU white-matter tractography atlas used for mapping brain connectomes.
parent class: brain region atlas image data set

label: image segmentation map
definition: An image data set of integer values in which each value corresponds to some shared characteristic or computed property. The values often belong to a group of pixels or voxels that share the same characteristic, such as a tissue type or anatomical region.
example of usage: The output of an algorithm that identifies pedestrians walking in a street from an image data set, where the output contains values only in the segment where the pedestrian is present.
term editor: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9625-1899 ""William D. Duncan"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9676-7377 ""Alexander D. Bartnik"",https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9990-8331 ""Alexander D. Diehl"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7245-3450 ""Lauren M. Wishnie"",https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9821-4132 ""Mackenzie T. Smith""
parent class: computed image data set

label: lesion mask
definition: An image data set where voxel intensity values greater than zero encode the location of some brain lesion and voxels outside the lesion have an intensity value of zero.
example of usage: The output produced by a manual or automated segmentation of lesions from a brain MRI.
parent class: image segmentation map

label: T1 lesion mask
definition: A lesion mask where the lesions are derived from a T1 weighted image data set.
example of usage: The output produced by a manual or automated segmentation of lesions from a T1w MRI.
parent class: lesion mask

label: T2 FLAIR lesion mask
definition: A lesion mask where the lesions are derived from a T2 FLAIR image data set.
example of usage: The output produced by a manual or automated segmentation of lesions from a T2w FLAIR MRI.
parent class: lesion mask
